diagnosis.score_summary: Dr.Althea suffers from a split personality: it poses as a "Pinterest-worthy" lifestyle object on its website but operates as a sterile "Pro Lab" instrument on Amazon. While the USP and Mission are aligned, the fundamental "Soul" of the brand (Archetypes, Narrative, Focus) is entirely contradictory, diluting both the emotional connection of the Founder story and the intellectual authority of the Institute.

truth_1.headline: The Pinterest Lab
truth_1.gap_description: The WWW signals 'Lifestyle Aesthetic' (Desire). The PDP signals 'Science Education' (Mechanism). You are selling a 'Shelfie' prop on WWW and a medical tool on Amazon.
truth_1.evidence: WWW: 'Pinterest-worthy packaging' (4/5 Depth) vs. PDP: 'Ingredient Focus... Pro Lab' (2/5 Depth)
truth_1.why_matters: Users buy the dream on Instagram but get a textbook on Amazon. It creates a bait-and-switch feeling where the product feels less 'cool' the closer you get to buying it.
truth_1.the_hard_choice: You are currently trying to be both a fashion accessory and a medical device. This confuses the use case: is it for the vanity or the medicine cabinet? You must choose: either scrub the 'Pinterest' vanity from the site and own the 'Pro Lab' grit globally (Option A), or dress up the Amazon listing with lifestyle photography to match the promise of beauty (Option B). You cannot win on 'Vibes' and 'Science' simultaneously without a bridge you haven't built yet.

truth_2.headline: The Missing Founder
truth_2.gap_description: WWW is 'The Personal Cure' driven by Founder Evelyn Lee. PDP is 'The Lab Breakthrough' driven by the Korea Institute. The hero of the story changes depending on the channel.
truth_2.evidence: WWW: 'Inspired by founder Evelyn Lee' vs. PDP: 'Korea Institute of Dermatological Sciences'
truth_2.why_matters: Emotional connection vs. Institutional trust. Who is the guarantor of efficacy? The woman who suffered or the white coat who tested? The customer doesn't know who to thank.
truth_2.the_hard_choice: You have two protagonists fighting for the spotlight. Option A: Fire the founder from the narrative and let the 'Korea Institute' carry the flag of institutional authority (PDP). Option B: Inject Evelyn's story into Amazon to give the cold science a soul (WWW). Currently, the website tells a story of human struggle, while Amazon tells a story of faceless statistics.

truth_3.headline: Heart vs. Head
truth_3.gap_description: WWW is 'The Caregiver' (Safe/Gentle). PDP is 'The Sage' (Smart/Proven). One hugs the customer; the other lectures them.
truth_3.evidence: WWW: 'Healing Spirit of Althea' (Caregiver 60%) vs. PDP: '345 Mechanism' (Sage 60%)
truth_3.why_matters: Inconsistency in archetype dilutes trust. Users don't know if they are being cared for or educated. The 'Goddess' narrative clashes with the 'Pro Lab' reality.
truth_3.the_hard_choice: Your brand soul is split between nurturing and analyzing. Option A: Align on 'The Sage' and focus purely on the intelligence of the '345' system, dropping the goddess myth. Option B: Align on 'The Caregiver' and simplify the complex data into pure comfort. Intelligence is not always comforting, and comfort is not always smart—you must pick your primary mode of service.

truth_4.headline: The Clinical Cold Front
truth_4.gap_description: Both channels use 'Pharma-Code' visuals, but the temperature drops significantly on Amazon. WWW is 'Aesthetic Clinical' (Spa lobby), while PDP is 'Hospital Clinical' (Operating room).
truth_4.evidence: Visual Temperature: WWW (2/5 Cool) vs. PDP (1/5 Sterile)
truth_4.why_matters: The drift from 'Clean' to 'Sterile' risks alienating the lifestyle buyer who wants efficacy without the feeling of medical pathology.
truth_4.the_hard_choice: Your Amazon presence feels like a hospital room compared to your website's spa lobby. This tonal drift makes the product feel harsher on the marketplace. You must decide: either warm up the Amazon assets with the beige/blue accents from the site to signal 'Lifestyle' (Option A), or freeze the website to match the stark 'Black-on-White' authority of the PDP (Option B). A brand cannot be 'Cool' and 'Cold' at the same time.

truth_5.headline: The Numbers Game
truth_5.gap_description: Both channels align on 'The Specialist' positioning, but PDP leans harder into the '345' numeric system. This intellectual coding fights the soft 'Althea' goddess narrative on the site but wins on the shelf.
truth_5.evidence: USP Alignment: 'The Specialist' (345 Relief Cream) scored 100%
truth_5.why_matters: The '345' concept is a 'Sage' tool that is currently under-leveraged on the 'Caregiver' website. It is the key to differentiating from generic 'Clean Beauty'.
truth_5.the_hard_choice: The '345' numeric coding is your strongest distinct asset, but it feels out of place next to the 'Goddess' narrative on your site. Option A: Go full 'Pro Lab' and make the numbers the hero of the brand identity globally, suppressing the soft story. Option B: Soften the numbers to let the goddess breathe. The Amazon data suggests the numbers sell the authority better than the myth—the untapped strength is in the math.

marker_1.so_what: WWW invokes a goddess (Althea) and nature; PDP invokes a lab and pathology. You are mixing mythology with dermatology.

marker_2.so_what: Consistently democratizing clinical skincare with accessible pricing and broad availability.

marker_3.so_what: Safety is the core value, though WWW leans slightly more into transparency/explanation than PDP's raw lists.

marker_4.so_what: WWW positions as a 'Clean Essentialist' (Sephora vibe); PDP positions as 'Medical Authority' (Pharmacy vibe).

marker_5.so_what: The brand maintains a consistent expert voice, though PDP is slightly cooler/more distant.

marker_6.so_what: WWW is a Nurturing Caregiver; PDP is an Intellectual Sage. One hugs, the other lectures.

marker_7.so_what: WWW is 'Modern Minimalist' (concise/helpful); PDP is 'Clinical Authority' (grave/dry).

marker_8.so_what: Both use Pharma-Code visuals, but PDP pushes the sterility to the extreme (hospital grade).

marker_9.so_what: WWW sells the 'Result' (Problem Solver); PDP sells the 'Component' (Chemist).

marker_10.so_what: The founder (Evelyn Lee) is the hero on the site, but she is erased on Amazon in favor of the 'Korea Institute'.

marker_11.so_what: WWW sells on 'Safe/Clean' lists (Vegan, Cruelty-Free); PDP sells on 'Dermatologist' authority and stats.

marker_12.so_what: Both channels successfully leverage the '345' coding to signal specialized care for acne-prone skin.

marker_13.so_what: WWW is designed to be looked at (Pinterest aesthetic); PDP is designed to be studied (Ingredient education).

marker_14.so_what: Both channels clearly communicate the function of soothing recovery and barrier repair.

marker_15.so_what: The promise of 'Relief' and safety from irritation is consistent across both channels.

marker_16.so_what: WWW appeals to the 'Trend-Setter' (TikTok relevance); PDP appeals to the 'Pragmatist' (Logical choice).

marker_17.so_what: High review counts and ratings on both channels drive a 'Safe Choice' herd mentality.
